title: Onboarding - Push Notifications
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded a fresh install of the Ballpark app (11.3.0 or greater)

NOTE: Android automatically enabled push and did not prompt the user when the user installs the application for BP ver 11.2.0 and prior. For 11.3.0 BP, a Notification Enable prompt should be shown prior to onboarding

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user navigates to My Profile page via Profile icon 
AND user navigates to My Notifications page, via 'My Notifications' menu option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[ANDROID]
THEN all notifications should be enabled for the user in settings (if user 'allowed' within prompt prior to onboarding)

[iOS]
THEN all notifications should be disabled for the user in settings (if never prev enabled)

title: Allow Notifications to Device Settings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (11.1.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user navigates to My Profile page via Profile icon
AND user navigates to My Notifications page, via 'My Notifications' menu option
custom_expected: Notification toggle directs user to OS notifications

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user toggles "Allow Notifications"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the application should navigate the user to settings within the operating system*


*[iOS] if not prev prompted from BP, then a prompt will be shown to enable notifications instead of directing to OS settings

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user toggles OFF "Allow Notifications" within OS settings
AND the user returns to the BP app (My Notifications page)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the change should be reflected within the app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user toggles "Allow Notifications"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the application should navigate the user to settings within the operating system

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user toggles ON "Allow Notifications" within OS settings
AND the user returns to the BP app (My Notifications page)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the change should be reflected within the app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user toggles an individual channel in app settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
(Android) 
THEN the app should navigate into OS settings for that specific notification

(iOS)
THEN the individual setting is toggled

custom_steps_separated.content:
(Android)
WHEN the user toggles an individual channel in app settings & toggles on/off the channel in OS settings

(iOS)
<SKIP STEP>
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app should reflect this change

title: OneSignal External User ID
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater)
AND user is NOT logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_expected:
The device in OneSignal should have an associated "External User ID" value set. OneSignal has a column specifically for external user IDs. 

NOTE: Since this value is never unset, there should always be a value associated with the device. There should be a value even if the user is already logged in and launches the app from a "cold start"

NOTE: The ID we are looking for is the UID. This can be derived from the access token which should be available from Charles in just about any network call we make. Once you have the access token, use this tool: https://jwt.io/ to decode it an validate the UID fields

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user logs into Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the EXTERNAL USER ID should be filled out with the OKTA ClientID on the OneSignal console and look similar to "00u8s1esrMX11rejf356"

OneSignal Dashboard 
[Ballpark QA App](https://dashboard.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/subscriptions )
[Ballpark](https://dashboard.onesignal.com/apps/6dfb24dd-9167-41c5-ba11-9da6fdbcaa5a/subscriptions )

title: Push Notification Validation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater & NOT the Production build)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user has push notifications enabled
AND the user has quit/closed BallPark App
custom_steps: From one signal user dashboard, create a push msg and send push to specific device(s)
custom_expected: client(s) will receive push

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends a [OneSignal Push Notification](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/campaigns) 

Steps:
1. Navigates to 'Push Notification' via OneSignal link above ('Messages' top-level tab, AND 'Push' sub-level tab)
2. Tap 'New Push'
3. Fill out New Push Notification appropriately, DO NOT INCLUDE LAUNCH URL
4. Tap 'Send to Test Device' button within Message section
5. Select specific test user/devices. (Add to Test Users, if not listed)
5a. Multiple devices can be selected (may want to validate at least one iOS and Android device each)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN message is successfully sent AND is indicated within OneSignal

AND the users devices should receive a notification
AND the received notification will display with Ballpark logo 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13374978)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user opens the received notification from the device(s)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Ballpark app is opened to the home page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user has push notifications disabled
AND the user has quit/closed BallPark App
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the notifications configuration for the account is set up to NOT receive any push notification

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends another push notification 

(changing the Title in the push message will help distinguish the different notifications)
(see step 2)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN message is successfully sent AND is indicated within OneSignal
AND the users device(s) should NOT receive a notification

title: Push Notification Deeplink - App in Background
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater & NOT the Production build)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the user has push notifications enabled
AND the user has BallPark App backgrounded


NOTE: Push Notification should be setup with deeplink in the "URL to launch" field and not the actual text of message
NOTE: On iOS make sure you do not have multiple versions of the app installed (Double check these links)

Deeplinks:
*webview: ballpark://webview?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpwa.venuetize.com%2FPWA%2FTexrq12raz%2F19%2Finitiate%3Fmodule%3DinSeatOrdering%26provider%3Dappetize%26type%3Dfnb&venueID=5325&dataTier=3
*wallet: ballpark://wallet

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends a [OneSignal Push Notification](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/campaigns) 

Steps:
1. Navigates to 'Push Notification' via OneSignal link above ('Messages' top-level tab, AND 'Push' sub-level tab)
2. Tap 'New Push'
3. Fill out New Push Notification appropriately INCLUDING A DEEPLINK WITHIN LAUNCH URL
4. Tap 'Send to Test Device' button within Message section
5. Select specific test user/devices. (Add to Test Users, if not listed)
5a. Multiple devices can be selected (may want to validate at least one iOS and Android device each)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN message is successfully sent AND is indicated within OneSignal
AND the users devices should receive a notification

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user opens the received notification from the device(s)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark app is opened to the proper location of the deeplink submitted in the push notification

example: ballpark://wallet directs user to the Tickets tab

title: [ANDROID] Notification Channels Validation - Team Promotions [ADD ONE-SIG LINKS]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater & NOT the Production build)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app


Notes:
*Android Oreo(8.0 OS) and above - There are no tags associated with the user. The user has full control over their own settings.
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has specific push notifications channels enabled
AND a push notification is sent to the specific channel
custom_expected:
THEN the user with the channel enabled should receive a notification
AND the user with the channel disabled should NOT receive a notification

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enables 'Allow Notification' within My Notifications page
AND the user enables 'Team Promotions' channel within My Notifications page
AND the user disables remaining channels('News & Announcements', 'Tickets & Events') within My Notifications page
AND the user closes/quits Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the notifications configuration for the account is set up to receive ONLY from 'Team Promotions' channel

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends a OneSignal Push Notification

Steps:
1. Navigates to 'Push Notification' via OneSignal link above ('Messages' top-level tab, AND 'Push' sub-level tab)
2. Tap 'New Push'
3. Fill out New Push Notification appropriately
3a. Within 'Platform Settings' for each platform, select/populate 'Team Promotions'
4. Tap 'Send to Test Device' button within Message section
5. Select specific test user/devices. (Add to Test Users, if not listed)
5a. Multiple devices can be selected (may want to validate at least one iOS and Android device each)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN message is successfully sent AND is indicated within OneSignal
AND the users device(s) should receive a notification

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enables 'Allow Notification' within My Notifications page
AND the user disables 'Team Promotions' channel within My Notifications page
AND the user disables remaining channels('News & Announcements', 'Tickets & Events') within My Notifications page
AND the user closes/quits Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the notifications configuration for the account is set up to NOT receive from 'Team Promotions' channel

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends another push notification directing to 'Team Promotions' channel 

(changing the Title in the push message will help distinguish the different notifications)
(see step 2)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN message is successfully sent AND is indicated within OneSignal
AND the users device(s) should NOT receive a notification as the notification has been disabled.

title: In-App Message trigger - Navbar Tabs
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater & NOT the Production build)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps:
From One signal create in app msg with following triggers
Home tab (regardless of no tickets or has tickets)

Key = ViewShown 

Values: 
- Home
- Wallet
- Team
- More 

When the key 'ViewShown' is set to a specific tab (as listed above), the configured in app message should not appear until the user navigates to the pre-configured tab.

*To have a InApp Message with trigger show up, you need to include an IN-APP TRIGGER and SESSION DURATION
*It has been noticed that the in-app triggers may need an app restart AND can take up to 5 mins to be shown
custom_expected: Test should be run for each navigation tab, and for each navigation tab, every OTHER tab should be clicked before the configured tab to ensure that the message does not appear in a tab it is not supposed to.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN an engineer sends a [OneSignal In-App Message](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/in_app_messages) 

NOTE: You can use prev created Messages(i.e Ticket Tab Test - SteveO), updating as needed and setting as Active. But if wanting to [create new](https://app.onesignal.com/apps/4419a06b-9a2b-4d44-a4a4-fe5fc93fcdd3/in_app_messages/new), follow steps below

Steps:
1. Navigates to 'In-App Messages' via OneSignal link above ('Messages' top-level tab, AND 'In-App' sub-level tab)

2. Tap 'New In-App'

3. AUDIENCE: Select 'Show to Particular Segments' and select appropriate segment

4. MESSAGE: Select Message Type, fill out Header text/display, Button action, etc 

5. TRIGGER: Select 'when certain conditions are satisfied during the session'
 
        Select 'in-app trigger' condition and apply 'ViewShown' as Key; 'Wallet' as value.
        Tap 'Add trigger' button
        Select 'Session Duration' condition and apply '5' as value.

6. SCHEDULE: Select desired rules to start/stop showing (and additional settings)

7. Tap 'Make Message Live' button

8. Confirm Before Sending and then Make Message Live

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the In-App message configured above should NOT be shown
